name: Jujube (Ziziphus jujuba)
summary: Jujube is a traditional medicinal fruit used for relaxation, sleep enhancement, digestive support, and immune modulation. It has adaptogenic and anxiolytic properties with a long history in traditional Chinese and Korean medicine.
description: Jujube, also known as Chinese date (Ziziphus jujuba), is a fruit-bearing plant used in traditional medicine for over 2,500 years. It is rich in flavonoids, saponins, and polysaccharides that are believed to contribute to its calming, antioxidant, and immune-supporting effects. Traditionally, jujube is used to relieve stress, improve sleep quality, support digestion, and enhance energy. Modern research is investigating its neuroprotective and anti-inflammatory potential, although most clinical evidence is preliminary.

metadata.natural_source: Ziziphus jujuba fruit, seeds, and leaves
metadata.fda_status: Dietary supplement (not FDA-approved for medical treatment)
treatment_duration: As needed or daily use depending on purpose

contraindications: Concurrent use with sedatives or hypnotics (potential additive effects)
Severe liver or kidney impairment (limited data)

items: Traditional use for calming the mind and improving sleep

sections.text: Jujube contains flavonoids, saponins, and polysaccharides that may modulate GABA-A receptors, contributing to sedative and anxiolytic effects. Its antioxidants protect against oxidative stress and neuroinflammation, while polysaccharides may support immune function and digestion.

adult.typical: 250–500 mg standardized extract once or twice daily, or 5–15 g dried fruit in decoction
adult.note: Dosing varies by preparation (fruit, seed extract, tea, capsule).

sections.pediatric: Not well established; traditional use in teas is sometimes reported, but safety not confirmed.

sections.text: May support sleep within days of consistent use; adaptogenic and immune effects may take several weeks.

other: May enhance sedative effects of alcohol, antihistamines, or benzodiazepines.
Safety during pregnancy and lactation is not established.
Some reports suggest possible mild hypoglycemic effects—caution in diabetes.

sections.pregnancy: Not recommended due to lack of safety data
sections.pediatrics: Not established; avoid unless supervised by a clinician
sections.geriatrics: Generally safe but monitor for excessive sedation

sections.text: Not typically required; may be discontinued abruptly if no adverse effects.

items: Frequently combined with other herbs in Traditional Chinese Medicine formulas (e.g., Suan Zao Ren Tang).
Seed extracts are often stronger sedatives than fruit extracts.
Rich in vitamin C and antioxidants, also consumed as food.

seo.title: Jujube (Ziziphus jujuba) – Herbal Sleep and Stress Supplement
seo.description: Jujube is a traditional herbal supplement used for sleep, relaxation, and digestive health, with adaptogenic and antioxidant properties.
